content.question: The architects of the building shown likely intended to elicit a sense of wonder from twelfth-century visitors through which of the following features?

choices.label: The imposing height of the nave, which is completely vaulted in stone
The clarity of the buildingâ€™s design, which avoids any nonfunctional elements
The expansive space of a large hypostyle hall, which features multiple rows of columns
The incorporation of stacked rows of horseshoe arches, which create visual rhythm

content.answer: The imposing height of the nave, which is completely vaulted in stone

unit.text: 3: Early Europe and Colonial Americas, 200 - 1750 CE

topic.text: 3.4: Purpose and Audience in Early European and Colonial American Art

skill.text: Skill 2.D: Explain how artistic decisions about form, style, materials, content, function, and/or context of a work of art (or group of related works of art) elicit a response or shape its reception.
